nodes.text: Having fun?
Do I sound like I'm having fun to you? This stupid lock refuses to open.
What do you think about disarming traps?
Well, I was going to put this in the list of 'stupid, useless things I have to learn for this class' along with lockpicking...
But I came across an old abandoned sailor's chest the other day in my explorations. I managed to pick the lock but I felt a pain in my wrist when I opened it.
The chest had been trapped. Fortunately, I had a potion of Antidote to counter it. Maybe if I had learned how to disarm traps, I wouldn't have wasted a potion.
So you found a practical use for tool use after all?
Yes. I guess the Rogue class is worth taking after all.
I don't have anything I want to talk to Katie about right now.
How are things going for you?
They'd be going a lot better if I could figure out how these stupid thieves' tools are supposed to work.
Esme learned things growing up like hunting and dancing. I learned the streets of Caligari. So what were you taught as a child?
My mother taught me how to run an inn, how to cook, and how to keep troublemakers in their place.
When I was little, whenever his ship was in port, my father taught me all about ships and seamanship.
It was only when I got older that he decided that I didn't need to know such things.
So are you mastering the art of picking locks?

nodes.name: Unlucky in Locks
nodes.description: Sounds like Katie is more frustrated than I am with using tools. Maybe I should try to help her sometime? It's not quite like the blind leading the blind... I hope.

nodes.text: (scoff) I don't know why we are supposed to learn this. It's not like I want to break into houses when I get out of here.
At least you won't need to worry about losing the key to your house.
No - I'm more likely to lose these thieves' tools - behind a safe after I throw them against the wall.

options.text: Ask About the Rope and Grapnel

nodes.text: So how are your rope and grapnel skills?
<sigh> About as nonexistent as my thieves' tools skills, apparently.
Good luck with this.
Thanks, I'll need it.
Just try again. Nothing can resist your charms for long.
Think of the lockpick as a ship you are steering through a narrow strait, and the pins are the rocks you are avoiding.
That's a terrible analogy!
That might explain why I'm having so much trouble picking locks, too.
Glad I'm not the only one.
<snort>
Would you like some help with it?
It's either that, or I throw the lock against the wall and hope that breaks it open.
That technique probably won't work with the locker, though.
You're left-handed, right? I think that's what your problem is. Try holding the torsion wrench in your right hand, and then pick with your left hand.
The handbook said to do it the other way around...
Well, that handbook doesn't know you very well, does it?
And you do?
Not as well as I'd like...
(grin)
(sigh)
You know, it's true. Locks are about as dumb as bricks.
All you have to do to open it is to outsmart it.
Surely you can outsmart a brick, can't you?
See you later.
Yeah. Thanks.
